node.title: Chaz Mostert smashes Bathurst lap record to earn pole position
node.description: Chaz Mostert has produced the fastest-ever time around the famed Mount Panorama circuit in a Top 10 Shootout to secure pole position for the Bathurst 1000.

node.title: Twitter got a new picture permissions policy, but it's being used by the far-right to escape scrutiny
node.description: Activists warned when the change was announced that it could be susceptible to misuse. That's exactly what's happening.

node.title: 'We back up our mates': Justin Langer stands up for 'our friend' Tim Paine
node.description: Justin Langer speaks about his trip to Tasmania to visit a "shattered" Tim Paine and why he is pleased to see Steve Smith back in a leadership role on the eve of the Ashes.

node.title: Honiara unrest: NZ police and army group departs to aid in peace efforts
node.description: A team of New Zealand police and army personnel have departed for Solomon Islands today to aid in efforts to restore peace after riots erupted over the past week.

node.title: Warning after potentially toxic algae found at Wainono Lagoon
node.description: A popular fishing spot in South Canterbury has been declared unsafe due to the presence of potentially toxic blue-green algae.

node.title: Citing Flawed Executions, Oklahoma Parole Board Pleads for Killer's Clemency, But Is Denied
node.description: One of the state's botched executions made a death row inmate suffer for 45 minutes before he finally died. Normally, the onset of death only takes 10 minutes.

node.title: Principal Out After Parents Find Sexual Content in Book on Optional English Reading List
node.description: On Thursday, the Paradise Valley Unified School District governing board voted to not renew Principal Linda Ihnat's contract, who works at Horizon High School.

node.title: First data points to Omicron re-infection risk
node.description: Scientists in South Africa have identified a spike in the numbers catching Covid-19 again.

node.title: Wairoa finally gets a traffic light - but it's red on the Covid-19 framework
node.description: Wairoa locals talk with reporter Tom Kitchin about the introduction of the traffic light system and how to increase their vaccinations to move up out of red.

node.title: U.S. Intelligence Sees Russian Plan for Possible Ukraine Invasion
node.description: An invasion force could include 175,000 troops, but U.S. officials stress that President Vladimir V. Putinâ€™s intentions remain unclear.

node.title: Thousands march against Victoria's pandemic legislation on day of 1,365 new COVID cases
node.description: Thousands of protesters calling for Victoria's pandemic legislation to be repealed march through the streets of Melbourne, as a similar demonstration takes place in Perth.

node.title: Iran nuclear talks on brink of crisis as adjourned to next week
node.description: Indirect US-Iranian talks on salvaging the 2015 Iran nuclear deal teetered on the brink of crisis on Friday as they broke off until next week.

node.title: Covid-19 update: 98 new community cases in NZ today
node.description: There are 98 new community cases of Covid-19 in New Zealand today, with cases in Auckland, Northland, Waikato, Bay of Plenty, Hawke's Bay, Nelson Tasman and Canterbury.

node.title: 'Rotten-Egg Stench' From Los Angeles Flood-Control Channel Spurs Violation Notices
node.description: The stench is due to a fire that started Sept. 30, SCAQMD said. It was at a warehouse in Carson where two companies kept a lot of wellness and beauty products.

node.title: Prosecutors Get Showy During Maxwell Trial, Bring Epstein's Massage Table Into Court
node.description: Prosecutors brought a massage table into court as a police officer testified it was taken from the same room in the mansion identified by an accuser this week.

node.title: Wairarapa DHB investigating staff function payment
node.description: Wairarapa DHB is investigating where Prezzy cards used to pay for a staff function came from.

node.title: Man hospitalised after being shot in west Auckland
node.description: A man is in hospital in a stable condition after being shot in Henderson, west Auckland.

node.title: Tourism industry 'not flavour of the month' with banks
node.description: A major South Island tourism operator has warned that banks are running out of goodwill towards the industry as the impact of Covid-19 continues to bite.

node.title: Man dies after water incident in Wainuiomata
node.description: A man has died after a water incident in Wainuiomata, south of East Harbour Regional Park, this afternoon.

node.title: Dismay over vaccine pass decision at New Plymouth council facilities
node.description: The New Plymouth Positive Ageing Trust says allowing people open access to many council facilities in the city without the use of a vaccine pass is putting lives at risk.

node.title: F.D.A. authorizes Eli Lilly antibody treatment for high-risk young children.
node.description: Doctors have a new option for the youngest patients who are vulnerable to the worst outcomes from Covid.

node.title: Tampa Bay Bucs Coach Says There Are Probably Other NFL Players Misrepresenting Vax Status
node.description: Bucs head coach Bruce Arians said his team cooperated with the league's investigation of his players' vaccination status and hopes it continues to other teams.

node.title: Minnesota Viking Everson Griffen Reveals Bipolar Diagnosis Week After Police Standoff
node.description: During the standoff, Griffen posted disturbing text messages and a video of himself holding a gun.

node.title: US Intelligence Says Russia Planning for a Ukraine Invasion With 100 Battalions, Artillery
node.description: An official speaking to the Associated Press said American intelligence shows Russian movement for a possible invasion is already underway.

node.title: In Oxford School Shooting, Sheriff Rips Prosecutor Over Parent's Escape
node.description: "We did not know these charges," the sheriff stated.

node.title: BHP's COVID vaccine mandate at a NSW mine has been found unlawful. Will it have national implications?
node.description: The Fair Work Commission says BHP's vaccine mandate at its Mt Arthur Coal mine was unlawful because workers weren't consulted properly, not because mandates are illegal.

node.title: Mississippi Death Row Inmate Asks State to Execute Him After '25-Year Wait for Justice'
node.description: "I ask to see that my execution should be carried out forthwith," said Grayson in a letter to the state Supreme Court justices filed Friday with the court.

node.title: Florida Woman Who Laundered Money for Child Exploitation Websites Gets 5 Years
node.description: Some of the kids on the website posed in "provocative" ways while wearing revealing costumes and underwear.

node.title: Judge Orders Removal of 8 Men From Sex Offender Registry to End Retroactive Punishment
node.description: Judge Aleta Trauger said in 2016, the 6th U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals ruled against retroactive implementation of a sex offender law in Michigan.

node.title: After 136 moves, Magnus Carlsen wins the longest game in World Chess Championship history
node.description: Norway's Magnus Carlsen takes a big step towards retaining the World Chess ChampionshipÂ after a marathon victory over his Russian challenger in game six of their title match.
